name: Trotterized Transverse-Field Ising Model
description: One first-order Trotter step simulating the 1D transverse-field Ising model on 4 qubits (J=1, h=0.5, dt=0.1).
long_description: Quantum simulation of the 1D transverse-field Ising model H = -J Σ ZᵢZᵢ₊₁ - h Σ Xᵢ. The first-order Trotter-Suzuki decomposition approximates e^{-iHt} ≈ (e^{iJdtZZ})^⊗ · (e^{ihdtX})^⊗ for small dt. The ZZ coupling is implemented via CNOT-Rz-CNOT; the X field via Rx rotations. Higher accuracy requires more Trotter steps (smaller dt) or higher-order formulas.
expected_output: State approximating e^{-iHt}|++++⟩ after one Trotter step

references.title: Lloyd, S. (1996). Universal Quantum Simulators. Science 273, 1073

author: OpenQC Community
